page.title: 14THE COMMON, HENFIELD -2-.
page.content: On the Common there is an area of woodland with a small stream flowing along. There is also a part called the Causeway, this has slightly raised banks either side of a ditch. One of the first things I saw was a large brown frog. There were three or four fragrant orchids which are quite rare but we didn't pick them because it is against the law as they are protected. There were ladybirds. In the ditch there were different creatures including tadpoles, pond skaters, water-boatmen, dragonflies and small frogs. There were many different trees to be seen including ash, oak, holly, bramble hawthorn, maple, silver birch and ivy. Wild life abounds mainly undisturbed apart from the traffic which races by. It is a very beautiful place and we in the village are proud of it.
